title: Anyone know of a Sans Serif capital "I" with Cross Bars?
content:
I'm working with Helvetica Neue Light right now and the Design features the letter spread apart.

But the I is just incredibly, incredibly skinny all by its little lonesome self.

Any suggestions? I need an I with a line striking through the top and bottom.
author: James Deux

comments.content: One sans with a serifed "I" that comes to mind is Bell Gothic. There are plenty more, too...
The skinny, lonesome, Helvetica "I," by the way, may get just cozy enough with a nice cup of custom kerning, rather than just relying on default letter-spacing algorithms. Good luck.
This is what Identifont [spat out](http://web.archive.org/web/20141012212434/http:/www.identifont.com/identify?9+I+9M+97+F+9J+Y+G39+76Y+9Z+U+M). It includes Info, Tahoma and Verdana.

@ Microspective

The letters are being arranged into a "Grid" pattern, a 5x3.

That said...

\*look left, looks right, blushes\*

I've realized Courier is the way to go! Haha.

Thank you all though for your suggestions.
[Panoptica](http://web.archive.org/web/20141012212434/http:/www.shinntype.com/panoptica.html) was designed for this kind of layout.
Thank you very much Nick. I will make sure to take note of that one.
